quadrants.title: Languages & Frameworks
quadrants.description: Include development languages and more low-level development frameworks, which help implement custom software of all kinds.

quadrants.title: Techniques
quadrants.description: Include elements of a software development process, such as continuous integration, and ways of creating software, such as progressive web applications.

quadrants.title: Platforms
quadrants.description: There are things that we build software on top of, such as mobile technologies like Android or generic kinds of platforms like Amazon Web Services.

quadrants.title: Tools
quadrants.description: These can be components, like databases, software development tools, such as version control systems.

rings.title: Adopt
rings.description: The Adopt ring represents tools that you should seriously consider using. We don’t say you should use these for every project; one should only use a tool in an appropriate context. However, an item in the Adopt ring represents something where there’s no doubt it’s proven and mature for use with the CHT.

rings.title: Trial
rings.description: The Trial ring is for tools ready for use but only partially proven as those in the Adopt ring. You should use these on a trial basis to decide whether they should be part of your toolkit. Others may already be using these items in production, likely as early adopters of the tools.

rings.title: Assess
rings.description: The Assess ring contains items to look at closely, but not necessarily trial yet - unless you think they would be a particularly good fit for you. Typically, items in the Assess ring are interesting and worth keeping an eye on.

rings.title: Stop
rings.description: The Stop (or Not Recommended) ring is for things we think implementers should avoid using or look for ways to move off of. These include items for which a better alternative is available, or where the item is found to not work correctly with the CHT.

labels.title: CHT Technology Radar for Contributors
labels.footer: The Community Health Toolkit (CHT) is a project by a group of leading organizations who have come together to support the development of digital health initiatives in the hardest-to-reach areas. It provides a collection of open source technologies and open access design, technical, and implementer resources that help you build and deploy digital tools for community health. Together, we envision a world where healthcare is of the highest attainable quality, equitable, accessible, and delivered by people who are trusted in their communities.
labels.notUpdated: This item was not updated in last three versions of the Radar. Nevertheless, it remains pertinent.
labels.pageAbout: How to use the CHT Technology Radar for Contributors?
labels.metaDescription: Stay at the forefront of software and trends with the CHT Technology Radar for Contributors. Explore insights on languages, frameworks, techniques, tools and more.
